radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple tumors, with a large tumor in the third lumbar vertebra.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive tumor disease; MRI visualized multiple metastases of the thoracic and sacral vertebrae compressing the spinal cord.

radiographic_examinations.findings: A large retrocardial thoracic mass, corresponding to the likely primary tumor and mediastinal lymph node metastases.
The tumor infiltrated the left ventricular myocardium and its pericardium.
Detected additional somatostatin receptor-positive tumor tissue in the pelvis and lungs.
Three tumor-suspect lesions on the right petrous bone and one focal lesion on the left skull base.
Tumor of the left carotid bifurcation, suspicious of a carotid body tumor.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: No relapse of the PGL has been observed by imaging.
